meanings.definition: Resonating with a deep, low sound
meanings.sent1: The cave was boomy, echoing every footstep.
meanings.sent2: The speaker's boomy voice filled the auditorium.
meanings.sent3: The boomy music made the cat jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The boomy thunder shook the windows.
meanings.sent5: The boomy drumbeat set the rhythm for the dancers.

meanings.sent1: The fireworks display was boomy and colorful.
meanings.sent2: The boomy explosion could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent3: The boomy party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent4: The boomy laughter of the children filled the park.
meanings.sent5: The boomy engine of the plane roared as it took off.

meanings.sent1: The lion's roar was boomy and intimidating.
meanings.sent2: The boomy bass guitar added depth to the music.
meanings.sent3: The boomy engine of the sports car turned heads.
meanings.sent4: The boomy sound of the gong signaled the start of the ceremony.
meanings.sent5: The boomy chant of the crowd filled the stadium.
